ProductFulfillmentDecompRule.name: ProductFulfillmentDecompRule
ProductFulfillmentDecompRule.description: Represents a rule that determines how an order is broken into sub-orders with specific technical details that help in order fulfillment. It can be applied to a commercial or a technical product.

DestinationProductId.description: The destination product for the decomposition rule.

DestinationIdentifier.description: The destination entity in the product fulfillment decomposition rule. This field can store a Salesforce product ID or an external identifier. This field is available in API version 65.0 and later.

LastReferencedDate.description: The most recent date when a user referenced this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The most recent date when a user viewed this record.

Name.description: The name of the decomposition rule.

OwnerId.description: The ID of the user who created the record.

Priority.description: The priority of the decomposition rule. Decomposition rules are executed in order of priority.

SourceProductClassificationId.description: The classification of the source product that's used for decomposition. This field is available in API version 62.0 and later.

SourceClassIdentifier.description: The source classification entity in the product fulfillment decomposition rule. This field can store a Salesforce product ID or an external identifier. This field is available in API version 65.0 and later.

SourceIdentifier.description: The source entity in the product fulfillment decomposition rule. This field can store a Salesforce product ID or an external identifier. This field is available in API version 65.0 and later.

SourceProductId.description: Source product for the decomposition rule.
